alert.note: Alert for Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 12:19PM CDT until April 23 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Prairie River near Taconite affecting Itasca County. Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Morrison and Crow Wing Counties. Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Aitkin and Crow Wing Counties. .Recent rain on top of a melting snowpack has increased river levels. The resultant runoff combined with water already routing through the headwaters will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected to continue. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Prairie River near Taconite. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, County Road 352 near Lawrence lake boat ramp becomes inundated. Flood waters cross County Road 319 near Crooked Lake. At 11.0 feet, Water level nears cabin on Lower Lawrence lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM CDT Monday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.3 feet this afternoon. Expect high water to continue through the week. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 05/01/1975. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Prairie River Taconite 10.0 11.2 Mon 10 am CD 11.2 11.0 10.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon by 500 PM CDT.
